channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - World
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2016 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Tunisian man sought in connection with Berlin attack
Germany in shock
item.description: Many Germans are in shock after a deadly terror attack on a Berlin Christmas market left 12 people dead and 48 injured. CNN's Erin McLaughlin reports.

item.title: Opinion: Trucks as killing machines
item.description: Peter Bergen: Terrorists have turned to a frightening weapon that often is within easy reach and is particularly hard to guard against: Using cars and trucks as killing machines

item.title: ISIS claims it inspired truck assault
item.description: German authorities released a man and intensified their manhunt for the person who plowed a tractor-trailer truck into a crowd at a Berlin Christmas market, even as ISIS claimed Tuesday that it inspired the attack.

item.title: Photos from the scene
item.description: A truck ran into a Christmas market in a major public square in Berlin, killing nine people and injuring at least 50 others, police said on Monday, December 19.

item.title: At least 29 people killed, 72 hurt, governor says
Watch an explosion tear through a fireworks market
item.description: An explosion at a large fireworks market near Mexico City injured at least 60 people, according to the coordinator of Mexico's national civil protection agency.

item.title: Why Chechnya conflict influences Russian action in Syria
item.description: Militants that routinely attack Russian government facilities may have pledged allegiance to ISIS. Nick Paton Walsh examines the implications for the Middle East conflict.

item.title: Trump meets with Carlos Slim whom he once disparaged
item.description: Donald Trump revealed newfound admiration for Mexican billionaire Carlos Slim Tuesday, praising one of the most powerful men in America's southern neighbor after previously characterizing him as part of a global anti-Trump conspiracy.

item.title: Lolo Jones: 'I am a tough chick'
item.description: US Winter and Summer Olympian, Lolo Jones, tells Don Riddell there should be no doubt she is one "tough chick."

item.title: Heaven's rock band got a lot better in 2016
item.description: From Natalie Cole to Bowie, to Prince, to Maurice White, George Martin and many more, a mighty chorus arrived in the hererafter this year, says Gene Seymour.

item.title: Turkey: Aleppo evacuations could be completed by Wednesday
item.description: A desperate operation to evacuate thousands of Syrians from eastern Aleppo could be completed by Wednesday, Turkey has claimed.

item.title: Berlin was 4th attack in 2 days
item.description: This holiday week erupted in an extraordinarily violent start, with high-profile attacks in four cities on Sunday and Monday.

item.title: Assassination photographer's chilling find
item.description: The Associated Press photographer who captured viral images of Russian ambassador Andrey Karlov's assassination at an art exhibition in Ankara has recalled the terrifying moment the gunman opened fire.

item.title: Russia 'determined to fight terror' after envoy's assassination
item.description: Russia has warned it will not make "concessions to terrorists" a day after its ambassador was gunned down in the Turkish capital Ankara.

item.title: EX-US envoy: This could escalate
item.description: One day after the assassination of Andrey Karlov -- Russia's ambassador to Turkey -- Christopher Hill says the deadly incident may be a symptom of a disease running rampant throughout the Asian nation.

item.title: Russia envoy's killer: 'Do not forget Aleppo'
item.description: Russia's ambassador to Turkey, Andrey Karlov, was shot Monday at an art exhibition in Ankara, Turkey's official Anadolu news agency reported.

item.title: Why Turkey and Russia need each other
item.description: Russian-Turkish relations did not come to a head yesterday. Nor are they likely to unravel anytime soon.

item.title: How Trump can respond to US hostage appeal
item.description: In an unprecedented public appeal to an incoming president, kidnapped American citizen Caitlin Coleman addressed President-elect Donald Trump directly in a video, urging him to secure the release of her and her family.

item.title: Russia won't change just because of an assassination
item.description: The murder of Andrey Karlov at an art exhibition in Ankara, Turkey, is a tragedy.

item.title: Why Snapchat's owner is hiring in China
Will data brokers help build a Muslim registry?
Where do Middle Eastern students want to work?
A new perspective of our planet
item.description: On Christmas Eve in 1968, Apollo 8 made the first manned mission to the moon. Live broadcasting from the spacecraft was the three-man crew of Frank Borman, Jim Lovell and William Anders, and it was on that day that their journey led them to an unexpected sight.

item.title: Galaxy count just increased 10x
item.description: Turns out we were wrong; there aren't 200 billion galaxies in the universe.

item.title: Study: Mars mission astronauts could experience brain damage
item.description: Astronauts on a mission to Mars will be expected to rely on their memory, multitasking and decision-making skills to handle the first manned expedition beyond the moon. But the harmful radiation from galactic cosmic rays throughout their journey could cause them to experience cognitive impairment in these key areas, as well as increased depression and anxiety, according to a new study.

item.title: New Mars probe searches for life
item.description: A new phase in the continuing search for life on Mars begins this month -- adding to a fleet of spacecraft probing the Red Planet.

item.title: What it would take to explore deep space
item.description: Imagine something so distant that with our current technology it would take 2,400 generations to reach there -- and that's just our nearest star.

item.title: The world's creepiest underground marvels
item.description: Ever had a tube journey from hell? How about a tube journey into hell -- or out of it, depending on which way you're traveling.
